name: Story Hotel

reviews.title: A happening hotel with a great location
reviews.text: The Story hotel is located in the posh Östermalmstorg neighbourhood, right next to a subway stop and a 15 minutes walk from the old town. The design of the hotel is quite unique and quirky with a happening bar and excellent and busy restaurant. The rooms have a very contemporary look and the staff was very helpful.

reviews.title: Fun hotel in central Stockholm
reviews.text: This is a great and quirky hotel. We stayed in the "Bathroom" which is a very nice room but one that has only a glass wall separating the bedroom from the bathroom. The ambiance of the hotel is great as is the location; very close to restaurants, shopping, sightseeing and the subway. The breakfast buffet included is excellent. Staff is friendly and helpful.

reviews.title: Hip and comfortable
reviews.text: Excellent hotel in a great location. 15 Minute walk to Central Station and Gamla Stan. Similar walking distance to Skansen Open AIr Museum, Architecture Museum, East Asian Arts Museum, and the Vasa. Great neighborhood with many restaurant choices ranging from McDonalds to fine international dining. Five minute walk to the waterfront. Subway footsteps out the door. Somewhat concealed entrance way off the street.

reviews.title: The perfect concept for hotel of next decade
reviews.text: Fast easy check-in and an impeccably clean room with interesting art on the walls. Loved the rainfall shower! I had one of the large doubles which had plenty of light and space to move about. There are two restaurants on the ground floor and a popular bar. Nice breakfast. My fourth floor room was quiet and faced the street. The guest profile seems to be a hip, well-off crowd either young in age or in spirit, which seems to fit the concept of this stylish boutique hotel.

reviews.title: Wonderful hotel, beautiful rooms, fantastic location
reviews.text: The only glitch that I can report is that housekeeping left an empty toilet paper roller (there was a spare under the sink which I used) and did not replenish the shampoo or soap over the three nights I stayed. I did not ask for refills and let it be.

reviews.title: An Amazing Story
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights and dind't want to leave. Excellent hotel with great restaurant and amazing bar ( best cocktails ever!!!) and nice music during week-ends. It's so lovely to enjoy the hotel and bar atmosphere that you don't even want to go out at night. Staff really friendly and keen on chatting.

reviews.title: Great weekend, great hotel, great city
reviews.text: It is 25 years since I was last in Stockholm, and the changes to the city have been dramatic indeed. The waterfront areas are all being (or have been) renovated and look absolutely wonderful on one of the first days of spring, in sparkling sunlight. (A bit like Venice without the feeling that everytihng is disappearing into the sea). I stayed with a friend for barely a weekend at Story Hotel and it was a quite magical experience. You enter from the brightness of the street into a "cavern-space" discreetly lit and with (in my experience) always an eye-catching receptionist in the lobby to welcome you. To the left is a wonderful restaurant/breakfast room, while to the right is a bar with a rear area useful for intimate meetings(!) or quiet business discussions.

reviews.title: Solid
reviews.text: The rooms are spacious, furnished in a modern minimilist style, with pictures from a local art collective on the walls. Beds are comfortable and large enough to sleep diagonally (if alone) ior in great comfort (if accompanied.)

reviews.title: Cool arty hotel with great bar and restaurant
reviews.text: The "Space Manager" (responsible for bookings) - Lota -is simply the nicest and most efficient I have encountered in nearly four decades of globe-trotting. She helped make outr stay truly memorable.

reviews.title: Perfect location - not the best staff though..
reviews.text: In short, this is a great hotel, in a wonderful city and I hope all who follow me there will have an equally outstanding weekend, as indeed I did.

reviews.title: Very hip and young - do not go there if you are over ....40?
reviews.text: Good location, excellent interior decoration - but way to small and noisy rooms if you are the least interested in sleeping. I think it might be an age thing - we are in our 50s (like sleeping aprox 6 hours a night ) and it felt like we were double the age of anyone else staying here. So if you want to be with the young "in crowd" - this is probably it. If you want to sit in a really cool lobby and people watch and feel like you are among peers and sip your GT while reading the Herald Tribune - go to Nobis.

reviews.title: Lovely hotel but staff need to be a bit more service minded
reviews.text: I love this hotel and I stay here a lot. Perfect location, cool restaurant, lovely back yard, good working facilities, and good food.

reviews.title: Great sweet stay
reviews.text: Unfortunately the staff are a bit arrogant and sometimes when calling reception I had to wait 20 minutes which is not acceptable, Otherwise very good value for money.

reviews.title: Chic, bohemian, centrally located... AMAZING
reviews.text: Ver nice hotel in the city center next to Metro station. Very friendly staff, funny clean and nicely decorated rooms. As mentioned before the rooms can be quite warm. The only thing that could be a little more extensive is the breakfast. Besides that it was very very nice and I would come back...

reviews.title: Really good experience at cool and quirky hotel in Stockholm
reviews.text: If you go to Stockholm, you MUST stay at the Story Hotel. I know it's not in any of the guide books, but this is one of the cutest hotels I've ever been to. The interior is very artsy, complete with original artwork that you can purchase. The toiletries are from Face Stockholm (so you know the hotel isn't cheap about giving you good quality products). I was traveling by myself so I stayed in the "Super Squeeze," which is a small room with a twin-sized bed. I didn't feel like it was small at all. Plus the bathroom was still a decent size. It basically looks exactly like the pictures on their websites. I also stayed at the Scandic Anglais for part of my stay, and the Story was 200 times better... there is really no comparison.

reviews.title: Would definitely recommend the hotel!
reviews.text: Tucked away in the centre of Stockholm, this was a surprising gem of a hotel. Rooms are well thought out making full use of every knook and cranny.

reviews.title: Great location, really clean, no hassles
reviews.text: Only negative was the over-sized extractor fans blasting out air.

reviews.title: Loved everything about it!
reviews.text: I will say it is a very nice hotel with lots of restaurants within a short walk.

reviews.title: Very Good Hip Hotel
reviews.text: Staff are really helpful, all in all a great stay, would definitely recommend the hotel.

reviews.title: Very pleasant surprise!
reviews.text: I am just echoing what other reviewers have said. This is a really good hotel in great location (right near the intersection of Gamla Stan and the Ocean Side harbor, and very close to the subway stop). We stayed at the Story for a long weekend, it is was very clean and comfortable. Self check-in and check-out was great. There is a bar and restaurant in the ground floor that seemed popular.

description: A very unique hotel in the very city center of Stockholm. The style is inspired by a combination of urban New York restaurants and bohemian Paris hotels. Located just steps away from Stureplan the Story Hotel provides full service:A lively bar and restaurant, 24-hour room service, free wireless Internet, Kiehl's bathroom amenities, luxurious Jensen beds, sheets made from organic wool, a safe and a fridge in every room. You should try it!
